column4: might sount stupid but is there any way i can just revet my system back to base
i did something stupid and really i dont thin i am going to fox it without doinng a revert
is there any way i can just revert everything to a base system arand ?
In which way? How should it be different from a reinstall?
if you specified the issue a bit more I think people might better be able to figure out what kind of "reversion" might be appropriate, if possible.

are you familiar iwth ruby programming, there is something called rubygems which the great peopl at debian figured it should not be used and completely owned the hwole gem update --system aspect, but if you want to use rails you want a new version not some old version
I have not used ruby, sorry.
so i installed that one first then installed the auto install script for mthe project website and they are all intermixed and just a mess if i remove it
its still there but the command does not work if i re install it in the apt it says the wrong version the one i attmpeted ot install manually
if you do just ruby setup.rb --destdir=~/tempdir/ You'll be able to look in there exactly what files the script pulls in, an presumably remove them automatically?
and for the package version you could do either "dpkg -L packagename", to get all contents there, or do "aptitude download packagename && dpkg-deb -x packagename ~/packagename_directory"
and look in that dir to check the stuff the package pulls in.
